alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 8:10PM CST until February 18 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Calhoun and Talladega. * WHEN...Until 215 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anniston, Oxford, Talladega, Sylacauga, Jacksonville, Childersburg, Piedmont, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Saks, Fort McClellan, Lincoln, Glencoe, Weaver, Vincent, Munford, Ohatchee and Hobson City.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
